creatures

Interface Creatures

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Boss
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BossFive, BossFour, BossOne, BossThree, BossTwo, ClayGolem, FleshGolem, Ghoul, Giant, Goblin, Golem, Hobgoblin, IronGolem, Monster, Ogre, Orc, Player, Skeleton, SkeletonWarrior, Zombie, ZombieHobgoblin, ZombieOgre, ZombieOrc

    public interface Creatures
    Interface used by the Player class and the AbstractMonster class.
    Version:
    1,0
    Author:
    Henrik Hagstr√∂m

    • Method Detail

      • status

        java.lang.String status()
        Shows the current info about the creature. Health, weapon, damage range and such.
        Returns:
        Everything you need to know in a nice package!

      • isAlive

        boolean isAlive()
        Checks if current health points is higher than zero. Sets the alive boolean to true or false depending on currentHp.

      • giveDmg

        int giveDmg()
        Damage given from the creature.
        Returns:
        random generated weapon damage plus strength, and amulet modifier for players.

      • takeDmg

        void takeDmg(int dmg)
        Damage taken from enemy creature. Reduces creature currentHp by (dmg - toughness), and - Amulet modifier for players.

      • getDmgTaken

        int getDmgTaken()
        Parameter used to get the current damage that was given, so it can be printed out.
        Returns:
        the damage that the monster took.

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Get the name of the creature.
        Returns:
        name.

      • getWeapon

        Weapon getWeapon()
        Gets the currently equipped weapon.
        Returns:
        weapon.

      • getHp

        int getHp()
        The maximum health points of the creature.
        Returns:
        healthPoints.

      • getCurrentHp

        int getCurrentHp()
        Get current health points.
        Returns:
        current health.

      • getToughness

        int getToughness()
        Get current toughness.
        Returns:
        the amount of toughness the creature has.

      • getStrength

        int getStrength()
        Gets the current strength of the creature.
        Returns:
        strength.

      • getLvl

        int getLvl()
        get the current level.
        Returns:
        shows the level of the creature.
